item.title: India’s Central Bank Withdraws Rs 2000 Notes From Circulation | Coingape
item.dc:creator: Anvesh Reddy
item.description:
India’s central bank, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday announced the withdrawal of the Rs 2000 denomination banknotes from circulation. However, the banknotes will continue to be legal tender. The move comes as part of the central bank’s “Clean Note Policy,” which prioritizes providing good quality currency notes. The RBI said a majority

The post India’s Central Bank Withdraws Rs 2000 Notes From Circulation appeared first on CoinGape.
